entry.title: Pacquiao v/s Mayweather. Why is it so important?
entry.summary: There are lots of fights in the world. Why is this so important?
entry.content:
I know this fight is the most awaited in latter days. But, well... that's just a fight like any other in the world. Also, I bet both Pacquiao any Mayweather are not so known before this event, so... What's the matter? When everybody is interested in boxing since? I respect some people that follow both guys since their careers, but why everybody? That's too fucking mainstream. And that's something I wonder.

I mean, with this, that's not a matter of you can watch it or not, but everybody got me fed up with that people comments every 5 minutes what's happening on TV.

Yes, I got fed up with the TV, specially if it's about showbiz world, but that's something I'll comment in a future post.

Jorgicio

entry.title: Tracking the site
entry.content:
z35W7z4v9z8w

Yes, you know, I submitted this blog to the Feed Shark service, and they asked me to create a new post with this code, so... there it goes.

Jorgicio

entry.title: Back to the origins
entry.summary: The best of my trip to my birth place
entry.content:
Well... as some people (closer to me) knows, I was born in Iquique in 1986. Because of some things of the life, I moved to Ovalle when was 3 months. After that, I got back to the north in February, 1994. I was 7 yet, but I was able to understand some things about my origins. 21 years later, in past summer, I got back again, and noticed how the family grew up, and it's still going on that. Lots of emotions came here.

When I recently went to Iquique, all parties are in family. So I'll go frequently. (No, La Serena and Ovalle won't be forgotten!)

My birth place itself grew up, too.

I also found some things I must noticed before, and changed my life.

  • My family is of Aymara descent, so me too.
  • I have some cute (female) cousins.
  • Oneself can move easily within the city. Taxis are cheaper than in other cities.
  • Culture itself is very closer to their Andean roots.
  • The past year earthquake (May, 2014) still shows its scars. Things in Iquique are still not fixed.
  • The mayor is an asshole. (Well... that's not any novelty)
  • In summer, it's so hot, that I didn't need to turn the heater on. (Anyway, it's broken)

As I want to go again, I hope it'd be for a month. And in aeroplane.

All my family (in both sides, maternal and fraternal) is very awesome. And things like that, make me worth them all.

XOXO.

Jorgicio

entry.title: My first post here
entry.content:
Hello, World!

Or so it must begin. Anyway.

I'm starting this alternative blog because I want to try the benefits of Pelican, a blog-oriented platform made in Python, what's my favourite programming language. Also, I want to improve my practice in English, so I'll write the posts in that language. Maybe I'll include some other languages, specially Spanish, my mother tongue.

If you wait for a description about myself, it won't be here, but in a page that will be available... soon. Meanwhile, you can watch everything about me in my personal site (in Spanish).

As I may learn about this, and having some break, I'll be posting here.

Thanks for reading. Any suggestions are welcome.

Jorgicio
